column1: round the wicket, full and straight, defended
wider outside off, full length, driven through point
that's a good-looking drive as he comes forward into a full delivery and puts it wide of mid-off
shorter outside off, extra bounce and it beats the top edge as he aims to square cut
back of a length, angled in at off stump, tucked off the hip into square leg
drives at a wide delivery outside off and it skews to short third man. Tidy start
over the wicket, full and straight, clipped wide of midwicket
fuller, at middle and leg, a bottom-handed whip into the leg side
a shorter delivery outside leg stump, comfortably pulled away backward of square
on the pads, wrong line, nicely timed through square leg and it races away
he's not got the line right, this is full on the pads again, flicked in front of square
on the pads again, not so full this time, worked through square for a brace...expensive and ill-directed over
slower ball, full outside off, this grips a little and beats the outside edge
short of a length outside off, pulled straight through mid-on who is back on the fence
pushed into the off side
gets well across outside off and tucks this into the leg side
another slower ball, dragged down outside off, a punchy short-arm jab to deep square
gets forward and pushes a full delivery square into the off side
over the wicket, starts with a big full toss, flicked to deep square
another full toss and this drilled straight down the ground, plenty of power in that from Short
again he can't pitch it, a low full toss, flicked down to long-on
full outside leg stump, worked to deep square leg
that's a good delivery, on a length at middle and off, defended to cover
full at off stump, clubbed to mid-on
back of a length outside off, driven into the ground on the off side and it's a scampered single to point
angled into the pads, tucked into square leg
gives himself room outside leg stump then lofts a full, straight delivery back over the bowler's head into the sightscreen
nudged into midwicket
stand and deliver! That's a wonderful clean strike, through the line of a length delivery, and over mid-off
back of a length, a slower ball that bounces a touch, played into backward point
over the wicket, full outside off, goes for a drive but doesn't make contact
shorter outside off, square driven to deep point
places a back-cut very nicely, a touch too short with a hint of width, placed perfectly between short third man and backward point
that's well bowled, short of a length, beats the outside edge as it angles across him
chops this into the pitch and it bounces to point
flayed over backward point! Takes advantage of some width, doesn't hold back, it's sliced a little but well over the fielder
full, wide outside off, and this time it's Short who drives and sends it over backward point
straightens the line, worked into the leg side
back of a length at middle and leg, he's across the crease and flicks to deep midwicket
and he's gone now! A rare mistake for Short. Full outside off, a slower ball, he goes for the drive but can't keep it down and cover snaffles it
gets across outside off to his first ball and punches into the covers
fuller, outside off, drives sweetly but straight to cover
short of a length on the pads, whipped to deep square
round the wicket, full outside off, miscues a drive and it runs through the leg side
back out the wicket, short outside leg stump, that's a freebie and Wade flicks it off his hip to fine leg
very full outside off, driven to mid-off
full, wide outside off, a swing and a miss
driven out to deep cover
this one swings late, into Wade, might have been an inside edge as he aims to work to the leg side
nicely driven straight down the ground
drives this over the off side, bat twists a little and he can't get the timing
short outside leg stump, this skids through at good pace, beats the top edge as he tries to pull
full outside off, eased through the covers
slips this down the leg side, but it swings again
dropped at long-off by Neser! That could be very costly. He sliced his drive in the air over cover, long-off made good ground and should have held on
oh dear! That's awful...round the wicket, a huge drag down, pulled through midwicket
worked from outside off down to long-on
now a massive full toss! Sorry, that's just rubbish. Called no-ball as well. Chest-high delivery and it's pulled over deep backward square
a very slow delivery outside off, pulled to the leg side, so the free hit doesn't cost too much
full and straight, worked to long-on and a better throw would have had Wade in trouble as he brings the dive out...he stumbled as he came back for the second
low full toss worked out to deep midwicket
short of a length outside off, driven to deep cover
over the wicket, short of a length outside off, driven to deep cover
full and straight, flicked to deep midwicket
hammered through the leg side, short of a length, a front foot pull through square leg...Rashid Khan can't get around, but was he in the right position?
short outside off, chopped to the covers
length ball at the stumps, opens the face and places into the off side
pushes a length ball into the covers. Pretty easy for Hurricanes at the moment
starts outside leg stump, aims to swing it away, miscues it down the leg side and Carey gets across
full and wide, driven through point
full and straight, driven down the ground to long-on and good running brings a second
full at off stump, firmly driven down the ground, this time long-off is able to prevent the second
moves well across outside off, a slower ball dips late on him, it's a full toss which he manages to flick to deep square
that's a big full toss from Neser this time, stump high, pulled through square and it's called no-ball for height so another free hit coming up
gets the yorker on target, Wade swings across the line, is bowled but it won't count
worked off the pads to the leg side
plays back to a shortish delivery and places this through point
tucks a straight delivery off the stumps to the leg side...sensible batting
he's gone stumped! as he misses a sweep by a long way at a googly which spins across him, neat take by Carey, Jewell overbalances out of the crease and it's a sharp piece of work
full outside off, jabbed into the leg side...Rashid chases it himself
full at the toes, clipped to deep square and it's an early call of two
back of a length outside off, pushed down the on side
there's a hint of top edge about this but it flies safely fine of short third man, touch of extra bounce meant Wade couldn't control the shot
gets the yorker in, clipped wide of long-on and there's an excellent result off a pretty good delivery
excellent yorker again...dug out back to Neser who throws at the stumps and it takes Wade on the back of his legs
and now he brings out the scoop! That's a superb shot, went across outside off then took this off the stumps over short fine leg
full outside off, gets a bottom edge into the pitch which bobbles towards Carey
back and across, worked into midwicket
good length, spins into him, plays back and picks out point
works this off the stumps into midwicket and the placement allows a second
dragged down very short, comes slowly off the surface, pulled to deep square
back of a length, straight, tapped into the leg side
full at middle and off, angles the bat and pushes into the covers
round the wicket, back of a length outside off, driven to deep cover
aims for something big over the leg side, but swings and misses against a full delivery outside off
well-directed short delivery, over middle and leg, beats McDermott's top edge and gloves as he pulls
what power! Connects brilliant with a full ball outside off, bottom hand comes through the shot, drills it straight of long-off
short of a length outside off, onto his toes and nudges into midwicket...doesn't go outside the circle but they make it into a two
short of a length, angled into the body, shoveled to long leg
short outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
touch short outside off, he rocks back and pulls over midwicket, goes one bounce to the man at cow corner
well bowled, fired in at the stumps, can't get it past the bowler
and this time he swings and misses across the line of a length delivery which skids on
that's out of the screws! And almost out of the crowd. Connects very sweetly with a slog sweep to delivery outside off and it goes miles over deep midwicket
tries a repeat and is lbw! A straighter delivery, a googly, McDermott misses and is taken on the back leg. Smashing middle
gets a long way under this, a slog sweep, Agar tries to get underneath it running back from short fine leg, never looked like he would get close
no century for Wade! He misses a low full toss, aiming to work through the leg side, takes the back pad. One of the easier lbw decisions you'll see
more late reverse swing, clipped off the toes into midwicket
full outside off, driven to deep cover
a short ball, beats the top edge as he swings, gets the dot ball
another slower ball outside off, some late swing, Bailey can't connect...good over from Laughlin
full at off stump, steered into the off side
swings himself off his feet against a delivery wide outside off...and it's called wide
gets a long way underneath this, and finds long-on...Bailey couldn't get his timing tonight, this went high but without the distance, a comfortable catch
full and straight, appeal for lbw, looked pretty straight but he gets a leg bye to the off side
edged, caught behind! The Strikers have got this ball to move. This straightens late on Faulkner, bounces as well, thin edge through to the keeper although not sure Faulkner thought he'd hit it
edged, and dropped by Carey! Diving to his right, can't hold it one-handed. Fantastic delivery, extra bounce from back of a length, shaping away from Archer who was pushing away from his body
swing and a miss to a full delivery outside off...a very fine over to finish by Neser
what's happened here?! A short ball, Archer was just trying to duck underneath it, leaves the bat up behind him and it glances off the toe down to third man
follows that with a fresh air shot
full and straight, flicked straight down the ground and long-on can't stop the second

dropped at long-on...a length delivery, a slower ball, he heaves it down the ground and Lehmann can't hold on low to the ground. He's also hurt his finger in the process and is going straight off the field
full at the stumps, a bottom-handed drive straight down the ground...useful hand from Archer
excellent catch at deep square as Archer sends a slower ball high into the leg side. For a moment looked liked Neser may have misjudged it, but holds on
full and straight, clipped wide of mid-on
edged! Wide of the lone slip, some nice shape away on a good length, Weatherald pushes away from his body
full, wide, swinging away and he swings and misses
full, slips down the leg side
length ball outside off, can't get any timing as he drives
wide outside off, throws his hands into a drive which he slices to third man
back of a length outside off, driven to point
round the wicket, fired in at leg stump, misses his pull
clears deep midwicket with a free swig of the arms, picks up a length delivery
plenty of air outside off, driven down the ground
gets across outside off and sweeps, bit of top edge but flies safely over backward square leg
slow outside off, he fetches it from quite wide and slog sweeps over deep midwicket
terrific shot! Swift footwork from Carey as he comes down the pitch and hammers this straight
short of a length outside off, upper cuts over point as the Strikers gain the early momentum
that's a beauty over the off side! All the way into the stands. A wonderful cover drive, on the up
full on the pads this time, clipped backward of square with timing and placement
length ball, slower delivery, into the pads
short of a length, angled into the body, he pulls it behind square as the boundaries keep flowing
dropped! By Archer moving back from mid-off. He's held some blinders but can't take this. Weatherald gave himself some room and was aiming for six over long-off, but didn't get the distance
drilled over cover! Full outside off, actually plays this off the back foot, sliced over the off sidfe
crunched! That's even more powerful. Gives himself a fraction of room and drills over extra cover
three in a row! Full outside off, moving onto leg stump, opens the face this time and drives over square cover
huge straight down the ground...this is an astonishing start from the Strikers, this time the ball is angling into Carey and he launches it over long-on
edged, but short of Wade, a shorter delivery from Archer, a slower ball with extra bounce, takes the glove and dies before Wade
moves across to the off side and tries to scoop this to fine leg
a slower ball, short of a length, he's through his shot early and it dribbles to the on side
round the wicket, full outside off, Carey slog sweeps and can't quite find the rope as long-on gets across
follows him outside leg stump, tucked to deep square
brings out the reverse sweep, finds short third man
moves away outside leg and drives inside-out over the covers
short of a length, goes deep in the crease and works to long-on
fired in full at off stump, plenty of bottom hand as he plays quite a straight slog-sweep...long-on gets close but can't haul it in
round the wicket, length ball angled into the pads, tucked behind square
a wide yorker outside off, dug out into the covers
another yorker, at the stumps this time, pushed down to long-on
a slower ball, out of the back of the hand, short outside off and pulled firmly to deep midwicket
another slower ball, full toss outside off, he can't make contact
another back-of-the-hand slower ball, lands just in front of deep square as he runs in, then he can't stop the ball
swings across the line
cut away from outside off, finds backward point
goes back, plays the cut, flies off a top edge wide of the keeper and fine of short third man
appeal for lbw as he misses a sweep but he's outside the line of off stump
swept from well outside off stump, along the ground to deep square
drives in the air over the off side, wide of the sweeper
low full toss outside off, clipped to deep midwicket
over the wicket, a straight length delivery, drives to deep cover
round the wicket, big full toss, clubbed through midwicket
a short ball, he rolls his wrists on a pull
backs away to the leg side and this beats the top edge as he aims to slash over the off side
touch short, cut through backward point
angles in at leg stump, short of a length, steps away and slices to short third man
spins away outside off, cut to deep cover
shorter outside off, not too far from carrying to backward point with the cut shot
places this square drive to deep cover
tossed up fuller and that's a wonderful shot, drives inside out over cover. Very classy
length ball round the wicket, tucked into the leg side
moves well outside leg stump and does brilliantly to angle a low full toss through short third man
round the wicket, full toss fired into the pads and deflects to the off side
short of a length outside off, steps away outside leg and taps towards backward point
length ball, goes for a reverse sweep or lap, not sure that's needed, gets taken on the pad and bobbles into the crease
saw him moving around the crease, sends it very wide down the leg side but there's no wide call! Carey can't believe it. There has been some iffy umpiring in the BBL. Barely stayed on the cut strip!
full and straight, tapped to the off side
width outside off, driven to deep cover
back of a length, played firmly into the off side

he's jabbed this back to the bowler...a full delivery outside off is sent back to the bowler, Milenko is appealing for the catch. Carey doesn't think he's out. They have gone to third umpire and it's confirmed as being out
round the wicket, full at off stump, played to backward point
wider outside off, slower ball, cut into backward point
short of a length, pulled to deep square
a punchy drive into the off side
played into the off side
a slower ball, full and straight, loses his shape as he swings to the leg side but gets a thick inside edge past his stumps
another escapes down the leg side, wide of a diving Wade, a full delivery angled in at leg stump, takes the inside edge again, between Weatherald's legs this time
back of a length, straight, driven into the covers
walks across his stumps and scoops this over short fine leg
brute force! Length ball outside off, clubbed straight down the ground
fuller, swung into the leg side
round the wicket, short of a length, slower ball, steered to short third man
another one thumped straight down the ground! This has been some wonderful striking by Weatherald. Dispatches a length delivery
a slower ball wide outside off, dragged to deep midwicket
round the wicket, pushed down the leg side...this one is called wide
excellent yorker at middle and leg, dug out into the on side
short outside off, played square to point
flicked off the stumps behind square
finds deep midwicket so no hundred for him...a slower ball, very short outside off, Weatherald swats it straight to the man who didn't have to move. A thrilling innings
another excellent yorker, skims past off stump as Lehmann plays over the top of it
full outside off, driven to deep cover
traps him lbw on the sweep, terrific comeback from Freeman, his first BBL wicket. Round the wicket, full at off stump, Lehmann doesn't make contact. Was it outside the line of off stump?
nicely bowled, good length outside off, he uses his feet then defends
uses his feet again and puts this over long-off...lovely swift footwork and a clean swing through the line
flatter outside off, square cut to deep cover
round the wicket, good length at off stump, angled into the covers
down the track then drives along the ground to deep cover as he got too close to the pitch of the ball
short of a length, sharp, defended off the splice
back of a length, played into midwicket
back cut to third man
round the wicket, worked off the pads to the leg side
a good short one, Ingram sways out of the line
full toss outside off, a ugly heave to the leg side and he doesn't make contact
full outside off, a strong square drive, Archer does really well to get across, dive and keep the ball in
charges down the pitch and there's no chance of stopping this one as he drives in the air over point
a sharp short ball, fended behind square. Took him by surprise
a short delivery, swung to deep midwicket
full and speared down the leg side
full and straight, slower ball, pushed to the on side
pulled off the hip to long leg
short outside off, sends it to deep cover
worked off the pads behind square on the leg side
uses his feet, Roses sees him coming, pushed back down the pitch
cut out to deep cover to bring the scores level
short of a length, whipped into midwicket and that's the game
